subject: Bumblebee 0.3
msgSnippet: Hi everybody, I just released Bumblebee 0.3. Bumblebee is a small framework that allows you to create documentation from executing code, at the moment from
messageBody:
Hi everybody,
I just released Bumblebee 0.3. Bumblebee is a small framework that
allows you to create documentation from executing code, at the moment
from JUnit 4.4 tests. If you spend a lot of time creating snippet
intense documentation for e.g. API's, this might be the thing for you.

At
http://www.agical.com/bumblebee/bumblebee_doc.html
you can see the generated doc for the latest release, and at
http://www.agical.com/bumblebee/download/bumblebee-0.3-dist.zip
you can download the whole thing, with sources, dependencies and more.

The theme for this release was to add functions for getting contents
from various sources to include in the output.That boiled down to
getting Bumblebee out of the way of Ruby and remove some of the
feature envy encountered.
The outcome is a more consequent syntax, with better Ruby integration
and better extensibility.
Maven2 was also thrown out as build system in favor of Buildr.
Hopefully the maven2 related stuff such as repositories will still
work as before.

Feel free to download and try it out! I'd really appreciate all sorts
of feedback, and I'd be happy to help you out if you have any trouble
with it.

If you could hint me for other places/lists where this kind of tool
would be appreciated, please drop me a line.

Cheers
Daniel

--
__________________________
Daniel.Brolund@...
